title.rendered: “IDF Thwarts Potential Attacks: Arrests 18 Suspects, Seizes Explosives and Weapons in Judea and Samaria”

content.rendered:
IDF spokesperson:

IDF soldiers arrested four suspects at the Tzufim crossing and located explosives in their vehicle. IDF, Shin Bet, and Border Police forces arrested 14 wanted individuals in Judea and Samaria overnight.

Yesterday (Thursday), IDF soldiers operating at the Tzufim crossing stopped a vehicle for inspection, in which four suspects were located. After searching the vehicle, the soldiers found an explosive device by the door and images of warfare materials on the suspects’ phones. The forces arrested the suspects who were transferred for further handling by security forces.

During the night, IDF, Shin Bet, and Border Police forces arrested 14 wanted individuals across Judea and Samaria.

In the village of A’ra and Tulkarm in the Menashe Brigade area, forces arrested five wanted individuals.

Additionally, IDF forces arrested two suspects near the village of El-Dad in the Etzion Brigade region during the night, on whom knives were found. In the Beit Yehuda area, weapons were seized.

The arrested suspects and seized warfare materials were transferred for further handling by security forces, with no injuries to our forces.

So far, since the beginning of the war, approximately 3,500 wanted individuals have been arrested across the Judea and Samaria Division and the Jordan Valley and Valleys Brigade, more than 1,500 of whom are affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.
